allData.occupation: Director of the Swiss National Cybersecurity Center

positions.title: Director National Cybersecurity Center
positions.description:
Strengthens cyber security in critical infrastructures, the economy, the education system, the population and in government, by leading the development and implementation of the National Cyber Strategy (NCS). 

Making cyber threats understandable by breaking down the complexity of cyber threats into tangible risks and possible mitigations for various audiences, in order to facilitate dialogue between government, business and society on cyber security. Thus, enabling partner organizations and clients alike to take active responsibility in reducing systemic risks.

Provides the means to prevent cyberattacks by reducing the attack surface presented by Swiss individuals and organizations in cyberspace. Drives the implementation of a national, digital platform to proactively warn organizations of threats, incidents and breaches, and provides them with the requisite intelligence and tooling to help prevent incidents.

Reduces the damage from cyber incidents by operating the GovCERT that helps victims to mitigate / deal with cyber attacks. Collects and disseminates threat intelligence to minimize the risk of incidents propagating.

Increases the security of digital products and services by promoting business models, which incentivize manufacturers to offer products and services that are both secure and affordable. Promotes transparency for users so that they can make informed decisions about the cyber security of products and services.

Heading interdepartmental committees on cyber risks and working closely with the cantons and the business community.

In the role of Federal Cyber Security Delegate established the new Swiss National Cyber and created the structures for its implementation.

positions.title: Chair of the OECD Working Party on Security in the Digital Economy
Special Officer (Captain)
positions.description:
Provide bi-directional flow of information between commanding officer and subordinate Cyber Defence units.

Responsible for the operational needs of the Cyber Defence units. Define possible courses of action and the risks attached during Cyber incidents. 

Conduct lessons learned to improve the doctrine of the Swiss Armed Forces.
positions.companyName: Swiss Armed Forces, Cyber Defence Staff (Militia Army)

positions.title: Head of IT Risk & Security
positions.description:
Developing the overall vision and strategy for risk in Zalando's Technology landscape. Tying the business risk & security management together. 

Bringing resilience to another level by introducing simulation and prediction approaches into risk management processes.

Keeping the Security Operations Center fully operational and ensuring 24/7/365 coverage. Planning and executing the future development of the Security Operations Center with a focus on automations. 

Influencing architectural decisions by challenging the architectural design, priorities, and risks in Zalando's technology landscape.

positions.title: Business Development Cyber & Intelligence
positions.description:
Responsible for developing the international cyber security business (with a strong focus on cyber security training) and the international intelligence business.

Improving time to market by strengthening cooperation with our Israeli technology partners. Developing new business by identifying and transfering technologies and knowledge to match European requirements.

Developing new opportunities in Switzerland and Europe by supporting regional representatives with in depth knowledge about the latest technological developments, economic trends and geopolitical necessities.

Generating new opportunities by carefully managing existing partnerships and building new, long lasting partnerships. Enable our partners to mutually benefit from our market experience.

Built the first cyber training center RUAG Training Support for Cyber in Switzerland in 6 month (project kickoff to first training given).

allData.headline: Director of the Swiss National Cybersecurity Center
allData.summary:
Out of the box thinking Cyber Security Specialist capable to connect technology, economics and politics to identify trends and opportunities beyond the obvious. Well respected for having innovative business ideas and being capable to implement them. Continuously evaluates and manages risks to ensure mission success.

Experienced leader. Known to take pragmatic, fact based decisions. Inspires team members and stakeholders alike to turn a vision into reality. Perceived as a reliable partner by customers. 

Likes challenges and enjoys working in a competitive environment. Open to constructive criticism. Provides direct, to the point feedback – both positive and negative. Shares information and enjoys presenting in front of audiences, both large and small. 

Excellent negotiation skills with both private industries and governmental bodies in the United States, Western and Eastern Europe. 

Considers continuous education a must.
